Name: No Vacancies
Description:
No Vacancies is a roll and write game where you take on the role of a Caravan Park owner. Four parks compete against each other to build the most infastructure, have the best attractions, book the most sites and attract the most customers.

This is achieved by rolling six dice three times and making the best combinations you can. As your park fills up allocating all dice becomes harder and unused dice means areas must be eliminated. Bonus cards can come in two ways. Firstly by completing a section of the park such as powered sites, unpowered sites, pool side sites, cabins, infastructure or attractions. Secondly by matching all the sites listed on customer card.

When your board is complete or all the customers are taken the game comes to an end. Add up all acquired sites and bonus cards to determine the winner.

No Vacancies combines the chance of the roll, with the risk of pushing your luck for bigger and better rewards. Strategy comes in the choices between completing sections, chasing customers or going for the big attractions.

—description from publisher

Name: Cut Throats Tavern
Description:
Cut Throats Tavern is the second adventure in the Zadorf series of mini solitaire card games, but can also be played as a stand-alone game.

Gamble, cheat, and risk your life in a variety of games as you try to raise the stake money required to enter into a game of Duel against Big G – the proprietor of Cut Throats Tavern.

All games are card based and you must work out the best strategy to increase your 3 Zeds (the currency around here) to 10 Zeds.

Gamble on the outcome of fights, try and outfox Roxy, and risk it all in a game of Russian Roulette against Mad Jack.

If you raise the 10 Zeds required you can then enter into a game of Duel against Big G. Win and you will gain weapons to aid you in your final adventure against the evil Lord Zadorf at a later date, lose and you will forever be in Big G’s debt!

Be careful how you tread, it’s not called Cut Throats Tavern for no reason!

—description from the publisher

Name: Adventure Tactics: Side Quest Guide Book 2 – Beyond the Tower
Description:
This book contains six bonus encounters, each one created by a special guest designer. These encounters are outside of the main Adventure Tactics campaign, and you can experience them in one of three different ways:

• As a one-shot adventure with brand new heroes
• As a side-quest with your main party of heroes
• As a progressive challenge for brand new heroes

Name: Arkham Archives: the Lovecraftian Gamebook Series
Description:
Four interactive adventures set in the world of the Cthulhu Mythos. Walk through the steps of Ace, the main character, as he faces Lovecraftian entities in different times and places, only to find himself on the verge of a catastrophe as old as Earth itself.

The game is played on four separate book, each telling the story of a new character, with different mechanics and goals. The common point lies in the card deck, which appears in the story as a key element too.

The project and the cards are a limited edition Kickstarter exclusive.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kopf & Würfel
Description:
Players move around the track to the center of the board by forming the longest words possible.

To start the game, the first player rolls the die from the Start circle and moves to their first circle.  They must then roll again and all players must try to form a word in that category, using the first letter indicated by the dice roll according to the table printed on the game board. The player with the longest word wins and moves his piece the same number of spaces as the letters in the word.

The first person to the center of the board wins.

Name: Massel
Description:
Each player receives 20 tiles, which he wants to get rid of as quickly as possible by rolling 2 dice.

You can get rid of a token by a matching roll in a not yet filled number compartment. If the number you roll matches a compartment that is already full, you must take all the tokens out instead.

The player who gets rid of all his tokens first is the winner.

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Farmer Bundle
Description:
My travels have taken me to the black corners of this land. I have seen wonders and terrors alike. I have huddled for warmth in alley and cave, drank of waters both foul and holy. I’ve lost every book I’ve read, every coin I’ve clutched, and every hand I’ve held. But here I sit, by my own hearth, on my own farm, surrounded by friends. Many a long night await you out there in the wilds. May the bread we break tonight carry you through, at least for a time. When you are lost, or cold, or lonely, remember this fire we shared. I am so thankful you’ve stuck by me, comrade. Please, stay awhile and listen...

Features):

     Update your first edition copy with everything new!
     Includes the revised second edition rulebook, updated errata cards and other content
     The Equipment Pack brings new life to previously text-only items and companions
     Contains new Vita/Power Point/Creature dial trackers
     Create your own stories and characters with the Adventure Creation Kit
     Experience six brutal stories in the Nightmare Tales book


—description from the publisher

Name: The Wolves of St Augustine: A scenario for Modern & Tales of Horror
Description:
Lieutenant Daniel Dulle and his squad from the 95th have been tasked with blowing up the bridge at Villa Verde to cover the retreating flank of the army. 
Normally this would be a job for the Royal Engineers, but a group of French dragoons are in hot pursuit.

This is a scenario for Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket

–description from the publisher

Name: Popcorn!
Description:
A fast and competitive card game in which players try to get a set or run of cards before the other players, while also trying not to get caught hogging too many kernels if someone else beats them to a set.

Each player is dealt a hand of five cards, and then once the dealer says go, players discard down to no less than three of their cards and takes up to two cards from the middle bowl. Players may also trade cards between each other until someone has a run or set of cards. Either 5 cards in sequential order, or 5 cards of the same kernels, or 5 cards of sequential kernels. Once the qualifications have been met the player to do so yells "Popcorn!" at which point all other players cease discarding.

Players then see which cards they have in hand that do not belong in their hand, and the Popcorn! player gets the sum of kernels on the combined cards. Cards are shuffled and redealt by the next dealer, and play continues until everyone has dealt, whoever has the most kernels is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Pharaon: Conflits
Description:
This first expansion for Pharaon adds conflicts to the already busy life of the children of the Pharaoh, and solving them can prove quite expensive, but also very rewarding.

Conflict tiles will be placed on several spots of the Wheel of Actions, substantially increasing the Action Cost for the corresponding areas. Paying this costs will gain the player Sword tokens, giving them access to the new Bonus Actions from the different areas.

This expansion also comes with new Nobles, Artisans and alternative Pharaoh tokens to enrich the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Call of Duty Black Ops
Description:
Played like traditional Monopoly.

Includes Custom COD themed gameboard, tokens, money, Chance/Community Chest cards etc. Play as Intel Case, RC-XD, Dragon Fire, Capture the Flag icon, Attack Dog, or Firebreak’s Helmet.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Backyard Baseball
Description:
Backyard Baseball captures the spirit of an impromptu game played by two teams of two kids each.  The game lasts three innings.  Each half-inning consists of a series of plays, each of which has four steps:

1. The fielding player positions the fielder pawn, then secretly chooses a pitch card.  
2. The batter chooses a batting card, both players reveal their cards, and roll the die. 
3. Compare the roll to the # on the pitcher's card; if it's less, check the pitcher's card to see where the ball goes, otherwise use the batter's card.  If the fielder pawn is there, it's an out, otherwise it's a hit!
4. The batter may try to extend the play and advance the runner(s), but the pitcher gets to play a card to try to throw the lead runner out.

The batting team only has two pawn, so when a pawn that's on base has to bat, it's replaced with a ghost runner.

If a runner reaches home, the batting team scores a point (run).

After three outs, the teams switch roles and repeat the process.

The team with the higher score after three innings wins!

—description from publisher

Name: La Juguetería
Description:
Each player receives a "wish list" card that they will keep in secret. In every round four “toy” cards will be revealed and all players can try to buy them using whatever money they have available. When several players want to buy the same toy, they must fight in a dice competition to decide who gets it (winning dice result appears in each card). Those players who don't buy anything in a round will win a coin.

The first player to complete their wish list wins the game.

There are 4 ways to play plus a solo rules as well.

Includes an expansion for the game "La Caza de la Calabaza" called La Caza de la Calabaza: Strawberry-Go-Round.

—description from publisher

Name: საფეხბურთო მენეჯერი (Football Manager)
Description:
áƒ¡áƒáƒ¤áƒ”áƒ®áƒ‘áƒ£áƒ áƒ—áƒ áƒ›áƒ”áƒœáƒ”áƒ¯áƒ”áƒ áƒ˜ (Football Manager) is designed for 2-4 people.

Travel the world of football, follow the rules of FIFA, meet rebellious fans, famous football agent will help you buy the players you want, negotiate with your rivals and make transfers.
Manage your budget, buy famous players and compete with your rivals according to the number of stars they own.

Goal of the game: collect one or more teams (10 football teams), develop them by buying a coach, a federation, earn income, bankrupt your rivals and WIN !

Name: ბიზნესმენი (Businessman)
Description:
áƒ‘áƒ˜áƒ–áƒœáƒ”áƒ¡áƒ›áƒ”áƒœáƒ˜ (Businessman) allows players to take the first steps in business and prepare for the many challenges in life.

The goal of the game is to buy more shares than all other players, bankrupt opponents, and accumulate the most capital.

Name: Grouch Couch
Description:
Ever wonder what happens to those little items that go missing in the couch? Now’s your chance to find out.

Take turns feeding Grouch Couch all kinds of tasty treats. Then press the remote-control and see what happens. He might grumble, chomp, burp and (hopefully) eat your treats! When he does, he’ll spit out Lost Goodies (coins). You’ll want to collect these because the player with the most Lost Goodies, wins.

Players roll the dice to see how many treats to feed the couch and also to see if they can take goodies that can take from another player.

Name: Legends of Gold
Description:
In Legends of Gold players are seeking the wealth of a forgotten civilization in an the ancient temple. You and your fellow treasure hunters compete for the most treasure, entering from different corners of the large hexagonal map.

To be victorious, you must make it out of the map with health remaining and the most victory points found on artifact, treasure and item cards. With a limited hand size, you'll need to balance Treasure and Artifacts with the item cards you'll need to get out alive. Navigate through the twisted corridors of the 65 hexagonal map tiles to get to the center where the most treasure lies. Each tile will either present a hazard or a trap sprung by an event card drafted by a player on their turn.

After choosing an event card, players will have one free action per turn, choose to either gather treasure or item cards, heal or move through the map revealing new tiles. On every cave-in event the lowest numbered tile is removed from the map. To hasten your escape, you may wish to trade a health for a second action. If you're not fast enough to be the first one out, you'll find yourself racing to find an exit as the map begins to disintegrate at an accelerated rate.

You may be close to making it out, but managing your health to prevent your elimination may slow you down as you stare down at a pit hazard with no rope item card, but then again, how far are the other treasure hunters? Are there any dangers in the upcoming event cards? Is there a week tile about to cave in on your path? Can you take the loss of health by entering the tile? Do you draw Item cards looking for a rope?

—description from publisher

Name: Nuke Trick
Description:
Nuke Trick is a trick taking card game with a few twists. As the commander of a World War III superpower you need to use all the weapons at your disposal in this all-out-war to control rare earth minerals, oil and strategic industries.

Players start with a hand of cards. Each round/trick is a battle over a few battleground cards placed in the middle of the table. The winner of the trick gets first pick on what battleground to conquer which is then placed face-up in front of that player. Then the 2nd best player in the trick gets to conquer a card etc.

Besides classical trick-taking strategies one must consider what continent the battleground card belongs to (set collection), what actions are triggered when you conquer the card (e.g. change current trump), if you can complete a nuke (which functions as “super trump”), if there are industries, oil, rare earth minerals or support to research space or drone warfare (worth dominance points) and if there is a strong resistance (negative points). The card you play in the current trick will be a new battleground card for the upcoming trick which must also be factored in when choosing what card to play.

The player with the most dominance points at the end of the game is the winner.

—description from publisher

Name: Erê: O Jogo dos Orixás
Description:
Erê: The Game of the Orixás is a card game about elements of the Yoruba religion found in Brazil today. Cards show different Orixás (deities), some with special effects, others with points for scoring. 
In each round, players draft five cards. Then they take turns playing one card each in front of them, using the effects when there is one, otherwise collecting sets. There are some open and some hidden objective cards, and the players will try to fulfill as many of these as possible. 
The player with most points after three rounds wins the game.

Name: Rani: Can you Save the Queen of Punjab?
Description:
The story takes place in the backdrop of British Raj in India. Rani, the Queen of Punjab was on her way to Amritsar along when she was attacked by a group of feisty rebels. Her Royal Guard defended her valiantly and safely brought her to an abandoned warehouse. Unfortunately, that warehouse was in an area under the British control and they were already looking for an excuse to pursue Rani.

The game is a battle between the two players. One player has to rescue Rani and her guards; the other player is the British soldiers trying to capture Rani.

If Rani can make it outside the warehouse to the truck with the keys, she wins! If the British capture Rani and kill her guards, they win.

—description from publisher

Name: Balkans 1944
Description:
In the late Summer of 1944, the Soviets were poised to invade the Balkans after having inflicted a crushing blow to the Wehrmacht at Belarus.  On August 20, 1944, after a period of relative calm in that front, the Soviets opened up their offensive between the Black Sea and the Carpathians. Despite of German counterattacks and setbacks such as Debrecen, by Christmas Eve the Red Army was besieging Budapest, had joined hands with the Yugoslav Partisans, and had occupied Bulgaria and Romania.

Balkans 1944 is a wargame simulation of the Soviet offensive across the Balkans of the late summer and fall of 1944. The Soviet-Yugoslav player must conquer as much territory as possible within a limited time frame, while the German-Hungarian-Croatian forces must try to delay the Soviet advance as much as possible.

Each game turn represents 10 days. Each hexagon is 30 miles (50 kilometers) from side to opposite side. Units are corps, divisions, brigades or equivalents and some specialized smaller units.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Joker Joker Joker
Description:
Based of the game show of the same name, Joker Joker Joker is a card based quiz game for the whole family to enjoy.

Each turn three category cards are flipped to mimic the game show's giant slot machine. These cards show jokers or numbers corresponding to question categories. Depending on how many times a category shows up in the slot cards, a question of that category's value increases from 50 to 100 to 200 (or 100 to 200 to 500 for jokers). Correct answers award points, but wrong answers give the next player a shot at the points. During a question round when a player reaches $500 they get to play the final prize round to end the show.

In the prize round the three slots are filled with a prize card from three decks of prize cards of varying values, and players can push their luck to turn over the slots one by one. Prizes accumulate for the player and cards reset as they push their luck until they reveal a devil card, choose to stop, or reach $1000 which gives them the big bonus of $5000.

The goal of the game is to have the most money after each player has had a turn as the master of ceremonies and at least one turn as a contestant.

—user summary

Name: Mio: Brädspelet
Description:
Mio is a co-op game where the players takes the role of a friend of Mio from the book Mio My Son by Astrid Lindgren to help Mio defeat Knight Kato. All the players uses the same pawn, and that is a pawn of Mio. The game has a board with 9 locations, including start and last location (Kato's castle) on it, and paths between those locations with 2-9 steps to walk. On top of the board is also places for 5 courage and 5 stonehearts.

The game play has four phases:
1. Mio moves.

2. The player does actions.
a) travel.
b) regain health or courage. 
c) pick up / change various protections.

3. You check if something bad or good happens (some steps on the paths are black, while most of them are white).

4. A cleaning phase where also Kato gradually gets stronger and stronger.

The game ends either when the players manage to take Mio to Kato's castle and defeat him, or when Mio loses all his courage and it has been replaced by Kato's stonehearts.

Name: Disney's Sport Goofy Tiddly Wink Tournament of Games
Description:
A "Tiddly Wink Tournament of Games", Disney's Sport Goofy Games features six different sports to play with friends and family. Included sports are soccer, basketball, baseball, golf, shuffleboard, and tennis.

In soccer, players drop 5 tiddly winks of their color randomly on their half of the field and take turns trying to use their Goofy figure base to shoot all 5 winks into their opponent's goal first.

In basketball, players try to shoot all 5 winks in the basket first in a h-o-r-s-e style game shooting a wink from each of the marked areas around the court.

In baseball, players take turns flipping winks across the diamond from home plate trying to land in hits and runs while not causing any fouls or outs. The player with the highest number wins.

In Golf, players take turns flipping winks from the tee towards a number of golf holes on a golf course printed sheet. The player with the lowest number wins.

In Shuffleboard, players take turns flipping their winks towards the scoring pyramid trying to rack up points without hitting the minus 10 zone. the player with the highest number wins.

Finally in tennis, players take turns flipping a wink over the cardboard net trying to force their opponent to miss the net or shoot out of bounds.

—user summary

Name: Jigsaw Monopoly: Lancaster PA
Description:
Jigsaw Monopoly features a 100 piece puzzle of the game board which adds to the fundraising selling point, but does not actually affect gameplay as a paper copy of the board is included should players not wish to complete a puzzle in order to play the game.

The game plays similarly to a traditional game of monopoly but features art of local businesses and landmarks to the Lancaster PA area. Jigsaw Monopoly does include new rules and features that differ to standard monopoly such as:


    The option to play the stock market at the end of a players turn
    The option to gamble money and properties against the bank for big payoffs which can change the game at any given turn and allows players with poor luck to turn the tide of a game. 


—user summary

Name: Il Gioco della Gallina
Description:
Learn the cycle of the seasons, the sustainable lifestyle, the Slow Food association and the Presidia around the world.

Each square includes a test: answer a question, mimic, draw, stand still for a turn or roll the dice.  Memory, ingenuity and imagination make your chicken run faster than that of the other players. The first chicken to cross the finish line ... wins!

—user summary

Name: Il Gioco della Fattoria
Description:
How does a farm work? How is organic honey produced? Who knows what are the ripening times of the tomato or how the vine is grown? Learning the rhythms and mechanisms of agriculture, the good one, and discovering the healthiest and quality foods by playing.

The players are called to face the tests of the game in four different categories: Vegetable Garden and Orchard, Olive Grove and Vineyard, Organic Agriculture and Farm Animals. Each category corresponds to a test, which will lead players to have to answer questions, mimic or draw, or play memory or misspelled words.

The farm game can be played individually or in teams and the winner will be whoever has obtained at least three points in each of the four categories.

—user summary

Name: Gods of War: Robert E.Lee
Description:
Gods of war - Robert E. Lee is a historical wargame, set in time of American Civil War and mid 19th century. 
You can play battles from Bull Run to Gettysburg but also from Solferino to Sedan.
The game is part of a series called gods of war. The first was the Gods of War – Napoleon. The game concerned the Napoleonic wars and was published only in Polish. 
Another planned title is Gods of War – Togo, which will enable naval battles in the period from the Battle of Trafalgar to the Battle of Tsushima. 
Each game in the series has its patron, general or admiral who won many battles. In the case of General Lee, he became the patron of the game due to the fact that the project initially concerned only the American Civil War. The game was very well received, so we created its second edition, which allows you to play through various conflicts in the mid-19th century, from the Crimean War to the Franco-Prussian War.

The main rulebook contains lists for the armies of the Union and the Confederacy. 
Successive armies and war theaters are issued with add-ons to the game. 
The first was the Rule Britannia which introduced two British armies – the main one and the colonial one. Their organization and armament concern the late 1850s and the first half of the 1860s, so they allow for the hypothetical participation of the British in the American Civil War, but also the 2nd Opium War, the Indian Mutiny, or even the expedition to Abyssinia.

Play the role of the commander-in-chief of an entire army and you will play the battle from this perspective. The game is therefore designed to play the greatest battles of the era, such as Gettysburg, Sedan, or Solferino. Your main task will be to manage your generals. You can have an excellent battleplan, but if you order an offensive to a cautious general or defense, to very aggressive one – your plan may fail. Imagine Jackson instead of Ewell at Gettysburg and you will get the point. Poor commander won’t be able to execute a sophisticated plan, but they may be good enough for a frontal assault or static defense. As a commander in chief you have to bear in mind all of this.

The fog of war is also very important. We use a system of patrol markers, at least half of them are “empty” (just a patrol) half of them hide corps. Your enemy does not now which patrol marker is just a patrol or a corps. Only when two patrol markers or patrol and a unit close to certain distance, they are revealed. And that’s how you again have to thing as a real commander in chief from mid 19th century. Is that hill in the middle a good spot for artillery? So is this enemy patrol marker just an empty marker or maybe his reserve artillery? You have to read terrain, and make a lot of guessing. Make a decisions without a full knowledge of your enemy positions. That’s the real mid 19th century warfare!

The game is scaled to easily play huge battles, so one infantry and cavalry stand is one brigade, one artillery stand is on brigade or battalion of artillery. Because of the focus of commanding many things like combat or movement are simplified. As a commander in chief you don’t bother about tactics of regiments or individual brigades, but you will watch the performance of entire corps, and divisions.

Recommended for 6mm.
Publisher produce own range of miniatures.

–description from the publisher
Families: History: Opium Wars and Taiping Rebellion

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – The Mad Titan's Shadow
Description:
The universe is full of both good and evil. Mighty heroes clash with dastardly villains in every galaxy, and yet one threat has risen above all the others. One being has established himself as a scourge on all life, whose power is unrivaled across all the cosmos.

Of course, we are talking about Thanos.

In this third campaign expansion for Marvel Champions: The Card Game, you and your fellow heroes must challenge the forces of Thanos. This massive expansion contains a brand-new campaign featuring five thrilling scenarios pitting you against members of the zealous Black Order, including Ebony Maw, Proxima Midnight, Corvus Glaive, and, of course, the Mad Titan himself. As with previous expansions, you can play each of these scenarios individually or as part of a larger campaign, and with a slew of new modular encounter sets, there will be ample opportunity to mix things up for all of your Marvel Champions content. Of course, a new wave of expansions means more heroes as well, and The Mad Titan’s Shadow starts it off with the mighty champions Adam Warlock and Spectrum, both of whom come with fully pre-built and ready-to-play decks right out of the box.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Discover Eden
Description: A fun trivia boardgame, focusing on the eden project and plant facts. Roll a die you construct yourself and move your quiz marker around the board, collecting 'card-tec' pieces until someone has 12 pieces and wins the game.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Death Battletome – Soulblight Gravelords
Description:
Afflicted by the terrible curse that gives them their name, the Soulblight Gravelords are powerful undead monstrosities eternally hungering for the blood that sustains them. Commanding legions of undead servants and terrifying monsters in the name of their creator, Nagash, these lords of Shyish make use of every means available to conquer the Mortal Realms and bring their prey into line.

In this book, you'll find out how the Soulblight curse came to be, the origins of its megalomaniacal creator, and the dynastic houses that have since sprung up across the breadth of vampire society. Battletome: Soulblight Gravelords is also packed with all the rules you need to create your own force of undead, from legions of shambling zombies to winged, fanged terrors that stalk the night sky.

This 128-page hardback book contains:


     A treasure trove of background information on the realm of Shyish, the Soulblight vampires, and their creator, the Great Necromancer Nagash
     Stunning art depicting the Soulblight and their undead servants
     40 warscrolls for everything from mighty Vampire Lords to humble Deathrattle Skeletons
     5 warscroll battalions
     Allegiance abilities for 5 separate Cursed Bloodlines, including battle traits, command traits, and artefacts of power
     A unique battleplan depicting a vampire's assault backed up by unending tides of undead
     Path to Glory campaign rules for creating a Soulblight Gravelords warband
     Two Spell Lores, Lore of the Vampires and Lore of the Deathmages
     A beautiful miniatures showcase and painting guide for getting the most out of your undead horde
     Pitched Battle profiles for all units featured in this battletome


—description from the publisher

Name: Tinunjoc: Pays Catalan
Description:
Tinunjoc Pays Catalan is a board game representing a course in the Pyrénées-Orientales department through its three valleys, the coast and the mountain.

The players start from the sea in the northeast to arrive in the southwest on the sacred mountain of the Catalans, the Canigou, preferably the first! The course is punctuated with pitfalls and nudges, incredible twists and turns (11 Adventure boxes) and 12 question boxes to test your knowledge of the Catalan country and above all... learn while having fun!

The winner is the first player to reach the Canigou.

110 questions of 2 levels of difficulty all the same!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Flip + Swap
Description:
Flip + Swap is an easy-to-learn abstract strategy game for 2 players in which you place, flip, and swap cards to make matches and win points.

During the game you’ll compete to arrange cards on the table and form adjacent pairs of matching cards (i.e., same color and same number). Each time you form an adjacent pair of matching cards, you receive the number of points shown on the matching cards. The first player to score 9 points wins the game.

—description from publisher

Name: Crossroll Hong Kong X Animal Inc
Description:
Crossroll Hong Kong X Animal Inc is a crossover expansion set which creatively merges the two NightDreamer games and add two more unique game experiences.

Crossover expansion adds more player interaction and risk management to the already strategic Crossroll Hong Kong mechanism.

Pyramid expansion uniquely merges secret identity to roll and write mechanism.

—description from publisher

Name: Die kleine Hexe / Neues vom Räuber Hotzenplotz
Description:
Contains Die kleine Hexe: nach dem Buch von Ottfried PreuÃŸler and Neues vom RÃ¤uber Hotzenplotz.

In Die kleine Hexe - following the children's book of Ottfried Preußler with the same name, each player will play the little sorceress once. The little sorceress tries to break the evil witches operations. So she attempts to burn the grimoires and witches' brooms. That child, whichs acts best, will win.

In Neues vom Räuber Hotzenplotz players get as many coins as possible from the treasure of the bandit Hotzenplotz; game ends if all coins are gone.

Name: Q-Memory
Description:
Q-Memory is a game where your memory is the only asset to fix the quantum link. With 18 hexagonal tiles, game modes that bring more challenging experiences and a 5-10 minute duration which makes this game the perfect filler game.

On their turn, players will try to finish the quantum link (which means revealing all of the tiles) but in order to do so, they need to follow the quantic sequence.

Each time a player flips up a hex-tile, it will have to connect with the previously revealed tile either on it´s core colour(black or white) or the background color. If they match, then the next tile revealed must match the opposite(if it matched the core, now it has to match the background color and vice versa). If, at any time, the conditions are not met, the player must flip back down all the tiles and the next player starts their turn.

The first player to finish the quantum link will be the winner of Q-Memory.

—description from publisher

Name: Звёздные империи: Альянс (Star Realms: United)
Description: Contains Assault, Command, Missions and Heroes packs.

Name: Wombat Kombat
Description:
In this game each player is a wombat general, managing their wombats.

Players recruit fighting wombats with different amounts of Poo. When players have two or more cards of the same wombat in their hands, they can lay these cards on the table (if they want) to collect Poo at the end of the game. If, however, an opponent lays out more cards of the same type, then the wombats of that type already on the table are flipped and placed in the respective player’s burrow, face-down. The game ends when one player lays down five different wombats in front of him/her or the Draw Pile is exhausted, then players proceed to collect Poo.

Each card depicts a wombat with a different fighting style. The number on a card indicates how many of that wombat is in the game – eighteen samurai wombats, for example, but only four boxer wombats. The number also indicates the amount of Poo that each type of wombat gives during scoring. Some cards have a special skill icon on the top left corner too, which only activates once (as you lay them down). It doesn’t matter how many cards with icons you have in one set of wombats.

The player with the most Poo wins. In case of a tie, tied players roll the power dice once (or more if still tied) to break the tie!

—description from publisher

Name: Ballen met stieren
Description:
In Ballen met Stieren players make their own selection and draft action cards. Then, they draw a hand of five cards from their own decks of bulls and action cards. Taking turns, they play a bull and an action card in order to execute an attack or defense. The game is won by the first player to score five goals, or the player who has scored the most goals at the end of the game. You also win immediately if your opponent gains three red cards.
A few tactical effects of your actions: when you gain a red card, you have to keep it in your hand, reducing your options from five to four.

In Ballen met Stieren, almost anything is allowed, including matchfixing, sliding and headbutting. However, you do risk penalties from the referee or the VAR.
Tactical options: substitutions, using different bulls, counter, etc.

In total, there are 28 different action cards in this game, which can make the difference in combination with the attack and defense power of the bulls themselves.

As they say: the ball is round, the meadow is filled with holes, you never know how the ball rolls or how a cow catches a hare. In short: be ready for a lot of soccer humor, fun and suspense...

—description from the publisher

(The description from the publisher uses various Dutch proverbs that do not translate well to English.)
Families: Series: Kaarten met Koeien (The Game Master BV)

Name: Honey Runner
Description: Honey Runner is a card game that uses the cards as templates to direct a Honey Bee to a central flower where they collect honey to take back to the bee hive. The goal of the game is to be the first player to collect three honey cards.

Name: Dungeon Universalis: Perfidiae
Description:
In this mode, you make bids competing with the other players, as you try to keep the balance between cooperation and competition, creating hazards and using sabotage on order to weaken the other heroes. Heroes must cooperate to accomplish the mission and get more Achievement Points than the Dark Player, but only one of them will win: the hero with the most Achievement Points (including the secret ones!). This fully new game mode includes a deck of cards where players will find more than 60 different events that will affect them or that may be used to affect their companions at key moments (you can trip a mate while he's running away from a powerful enemy, push him into the bottom of a pit, poison the water in a fountain just before an ally drinks from it, loot the contents of a chest while no one is looking, announce that you are an infiltrated enemy when you deem the time is right...).

Use: 3-6 players. Ideal for playing independent adventures. This great game mode will make your games hilarious and full of mistrust towards your mates. It can be played in the cooperative mode (with the Artificial Intelligence) or with a human Dark Player.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Universalis: Campaign & Quest Book II
Description:
Immerse yourself in another great campaign and take part in a plot full of resentments and betrayals among the nobles and merchants of the kingdom of Alania. New challenges for your groups of heroes.

Use: A great narrative campaign with 21 missions and 4 independent adventures. All the SGs unlocked during the campaign will be added to this book (new campaigns and missions).

Contents: a full color book of about 64 pages plus extras. TOTAL: 150+ hour experience.

Extras SG: Tales of fangs and claws (3 quests), The lord of spiders (6 quests), The totem Island (6 quests) +7 independent quests.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Universalis: Bestiary II
Description:
Is the first bestiary not enought for you? Don't worry. This is the Bestiary book-II with more than 260 other creatures and 25 new factions, including kingdoms and clans of your favorite series, novels and movies. This Bestiary will allow you to play factions included in forthcoming official quest books.

Contents: full color, 48 page book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Universalis: Bestiary Cards & Legendary Encounters
Description:
This box includes the Bestiary cards for 12 factions, and include the complete profile of each creature and all the extra information. Some of the behaviors are somewhat different from what you will find in the behavior cards from the base game. All the creatures included here have their own standee as part of the contents that come with the game box.

In addition, the box includes the rules to play the new game mode: Legendary Encounters. This game mode will allow your heroes to face the different creatures that live ina certain kind of territory as they travel through it. And also as part of the quests located in that specific terrain. Thus, they will be more likely to find an Underworld Dog in a volcanic territory than in a forest, where they will probably face a Giant Spider.

Use: these cards will make the set-up for your games easier and faster, since you   won´t need to check the books or other cards to discover the effects of the skills, weapons and behaviors of each creature. They are also necessary to play the "Legendary Encounters" mode.

Contents: 192 large cards (120x80 mm.) + 1 Bestiary Cards box + 1 set of rules to play the Legendary Encounters mode. Factions and creatures included in the box: Great Orc Tribes, Goblin Clans, Hosts of Bandmor, Thai-Shiang Empire, Corsairs, Northern Barbarians, Bandits, Creatures of the Night, Devastators, Daemons, Human Kingdoms, Fantastic Insects. Independent creatures (dragons, giant lizards, golems, elementals...).

—description from the publisher

Name: Kings of War: Shadows in the North – 2 Player Starter Set
Description:
The Nightstalkers have come. Having slithered past the Northern Alliance's defences, an army now marches towards the fortress city of Chill with a terrible, insatiable hunger.
The desperate patrols of the Northern Alliance must hold them back at all costs, or risk losing their homelands and the secret at the heart of the city that they have sworn to protect.

Kings of War is a mass-battle fantasy wargame set in the world of Pannithor. 
Rank upon rank of soldiers march into bloody combat, while winged demons battle fiery dragons overhead. 
From launching devastating bombardments of artillery, to tactically out-flanking your opponent's forces, Kings of War is a game of exciting, expansive fantasy battles.

This starter set contains two great plastic starter armies for Kings of War (the foul Nightstalkers and the noble Northern Alliance), a softback book with the full game rules, complete army lists for 14 different factions, and a getting started booklet to help you with your first games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Complots Faciles pour Briller en Société
Description:
Players compose conspiracy theories from the "Them" and "What" cards in their hands and vote to determine which one they like best.

Each round is started by the player holding the "Lanceur d'Alerte" card (= first player card) and begins with each player having 3 "Them" and 3 "What" cards. Players cannot vote for themselves during voting.

On each round, the player who received the most votes will score as much victory points ("points de Sachoir") as the number of cards used to compose his/her conspiracy theory. If a player reaches 10 or more "points de Sachoir", the game ends and he/she is the winner. Else the "Lanceur d'Alerte" card is given to the next player and a new round begins.

The game offers 4 game modes (or Research Methods): Toutélié - Did you know? - As by Chance! - I know, you believe ...
At the start of the game, you can choose which Research Method you prefer or use certain Research Methods cards to play with them during the game.

—description from publisher

Name: Մաֆիա (Mafia)
Description:
In Õ„Õ¡Ö†Õ«Õ¡ ("Mafia"), teams compete against each other to see which team can find all of its agents first. 
The "don" or the "cop" gives a one-word hint that can refer to several words on the board. 
Team members try to guess the words, avoiding guessing the words of the opposing team. 
At the same time, everyone avoids killers.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Zero Leader: Aces Expansion
Description:
Get 56 cards of Japanese Aces and Elite Pilots.  New pilots to use in your Zero Leader battles and campaigns.

52 Japanese Pilot cards with “Legendary” status
4 New Event cards
- Unreasonable Expectations 
- He is with Us!
- Lack of Leadership 
- Powerful Presence

Most of these pilots have additional keyword abilities like Diligent, Smart Landing, Quick Hands, and Arrogant that will improve their odds of completing or surviving a mission.

Name: Zero Leader: Trainee Expansion
Description:
56 Cards of barely trained pilots that are worse than Recruits. You can train them up and promote them. The expansion also includes new Event cards!

- 54 Pilot cards designated as trainees with no special abilities and lower rolls to become shaken. Their cost for deck inclusion is obviously cheaper.

2 new Event Cards
- Rising to the Challenge 
- Strained

Name: Zero Leader: China Expansion
Description:
Get 56 cards, 5 campaign sheets, and a countersheet.
New aircraft, armament, events, and campaigns in China.  Expand your mission in Zero Leader with the Japanese campaign into China and Burma.

Campaigns include:
- Burma 1942
- Singapore 1942
- Indian Ocean Raid 1942
- China 1941
- Malaya 1942

New Aircraft include:
- Hurricanes 
- I-16’s
- I-15’s
- P40’s

Name: Quitter
Description:
The card game for people that like to pretend they are quitting social media.

Quitter has two decks.  The first is the Scroll deck.  This represents using social media. You draw from this at the END of your turn, constantly thwarting your own attempts to use all your cards and end with an empty hand.

The second is the Real Life deck. You have to earn draws from this deck. It's a mixed bag, but each good card reduces the amount of cards you need to draw each turn. Some of them also have power ups that help you get rid of your cards quicker.

Share Content to collect Reacts and then spend that emotional currency to draw from the Real Life deck. The more Real Life cards you have on the board the less Content you'll have to draw at the end of each turn. When you end a turn with no cards in hand and no draw requirement you win the game by being a Quitter.

—description from publisher

Name: Ars Bellum II
Description:
The basic module contains

     1 rulebook of 17 pages with the principles of the game and many illustrated examples
     1 player aid
     1 board of 108 pawns and markers to play the English and French armies of the campaign
     4 scenarios: 
         the battles of Abbeville (23 August 1346), 
         Oisemont (23 August 1346), 
         Gué de Blanquetaque (24 August 1346) and 
         Crécy (26 August 1346)
    
     4 A3 cards 


—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Classic F1
Description:
Classic F1 is a lap by lap reproduction of Formula One auto racing. The game comes with all 33 Formula One champs, as well as all the active drivers from 2019. Every year, car, and constructor for each driver is represented individually and normalized across the history of the sport so you can match, for example, Fangio, Stewart, Senna or Hamilton head-to-head in any car they drove during their careers. 
Additional drivers are also available by decade, including a pre-1950s set including such greats as Nuvolari, Rosemeyer and Wimille.

Each driver card has ratings for speed & tactics, qualifying, fastest laps, passing, defending, ability in the rain, accidents and potential mechanical issues, to name but a few. Speedy drivers who excel on fast tracks will do the same here, while tacticians will show their worth on hard to pass tracks like Monaco. Drivers prone to accidents will have more issues than others and cars prone to breaking down with mechanical issues will have difficulty finishing a race.

Each of the tracks from 2019 are represented their own chart which will determine the events during the race based on a die roll. These results may require further checks to the track chart or examining one or more driver ratings for the track action over one or more laps. Tracks that favor a fast driver will do so, while tracks that test a car’s endurance will have more mechanical checks. Each track has its own historic weather check. The ability to pass on the various tracks is represented as well; tracks like Hungaroring will have few passing opportunities, while Monza will have more chances. Some tracks also give the driver the option for a one or two stop pit strategy. No two tracks are alike and the Track Set 2 provides an additional 20 classic circuits including Bremgarten, Detroit, Mt. Tremblant and the daunting Nurburgring "Nordschleife."

Every aspect of F1 is here - driver, car & circuit variety,  qualifying, the chaos of lap one, accidents, safety cars and breakdowns. Qualifying takes about a half hour to run; a race can be run in roughly an hour and a half. There is some basic math involved, as you do not move on a track but rather, calculate the number of “spaces moved” for each car/driver, based on the results of a die roll, cross-referenced against the specific race track used as well as the driver/car ratings. The positions after each turn represent a certain amount of time behind the leader and after a pre-determined number of laps have been completed the driver in the lead wins the race. The broad range of random and not-so-random results make no two races the same.

There has never been as detailed a representation of the sport’s history as this game offers.

Name: Feuds & Favors
Description:
Feuds & Favors is a medieval-themed, turn-based, strategy card game featuring rival clans that are all competing for the title "The Paramount Legion"; the most respected title in the kingdom. Players use stacks of cards, called companies, as their legion.

On their turn, players must choose a series of 2 or 3 actions to further their cause. They can make an optional opening move but must make a positioning action followed by a main action.

Players can battle with each other by choosing one of their cards to bring into combat with an opponent's. They can also gain permanent and temporary bonuses through quests and influential figures. A player may even lay cards that affect a battle when they are not a part of it.

There are two ways to win: Victory by collection of trophies (similar to victory points) or by survival (think last man standing).

—description from publisher

Name: Mussel Madness in the Great Lakes
Description:
You must help your Lake survive several waves of Mussel Invasion. Mussels eat your Phytos. The more Phytos you have, the more Fish Bucks you can earn. The Lake with the most Fish Bucks wins, except that if any Lake loses, no one can win.

This is a roll and move game where the spaces determine what happens in your lake; specifically, the phytoplankton (phytos), mussels, and algae balance. Phytos are the good guys. Mussels eat the phytos and therefore allow the algae to grow with the increased sunlight. If there is algae in your lake, the phytos can't multiply, but the mussels will. Players can earn Fish Bucks through card actions which can then be used to clean up the algae and mussels, but as with most environmental issues, funding is hard to come by!

After a predetermined number of trips around the board (years), everyone loses if anyone's lake is devoid of phytos. If everyone still has phytos left, then one winner is determined by a point system, and the player with the healthiest Great Lake is the winner!

Name: Shuffle: Star Wars Rebels
Description:
“The Empire are hunting down the Rebels who are hiding out across planet Lothal.”

The aim of the game is to capture and control Territories, by winning battles as the Rebels or as the Empire. The character card(s) played with the highest total power score capture the Territory to win a round. Matching skills with the Territory's properties increases the total power score.

The first in a 2-player or 2-team game to capture four Territories wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Godtear: Maxen, the Artificer & Gearhawks
Description:
Unleash the firestorm with Maxen, the Artificer.

Possessed of a brilliant mind, Maxen easily grasps concepts beyond mortal understanding. Proof can be seen in his flock of mechanical Gearhawks. These helpful clockwork creatures perform tasks and may even be used as ammunition, in a pinch.

Inside this box is everything you need to add the Slayer champion Maxen, the Artificer, to your Godtear warband. Use this expansion with any Godtear starter set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zaka
Description:
Zaka is a light-hearted strategy card game set in a magical and monster-filled realm called "Zaka". In this game, players each build an army of whimsical monsters and then battle their way to victory using their monsters’ unique abilities and a hoard of dangerous weapons.

This fully self-contained game provides an intuitively easy-to-learn and party-ready spin on the classic genre of fantasy battle card games. To play, each player collects monster cards, upgrades them with compatible weapon cards, then uses their available special abilities to destroy enemy threats and take control of the battlefield. But players must plan their moves carefully to maximise their loot without attracting the wrath of opponent monster armies!

Designed to encourage lots of cheeky player interaction and treachery, this game suits both skilled strategists and first-time gamers alike.'

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Bringers of Death
Description:
Death stalks the Bloodwind Spoil. Nagash’s gaze turns towards this nightmare realm of slaughter and butchery, and he sends his midnight armies to claim the souls that he believes are rightfully his. Perhaps smaller warbands will succeed where his invasion has failed. Even now they chip away at the domains of the living with the cold patience of the grave, taking what land they can and replacing the madness with the unmoving, unchanging, unfeeling calm of the dead – in the name of the Great Necromancer.

Bringers of Death is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Death in games of Warcry. Four large warbands are detailed in full, from the ethereal Nighthaunt to the disciplined Ossiarch Bonereapers. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Death in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


     Full rules for the following warbands: Flesh-eater Courts, Legions of Nagash, Nighthaunt, and Ossiarch Bonereapers.
     Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Death ranges.
     Rules for two Monsters of Death: Terrorgheists and Zombie Dragons.
     Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
     New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
     Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
     4 Death Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
     6 Death Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.


If you feel compelled to collect the souls of the Eightpoints in the name of Nagash, this 64-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Terraforming Mars: Bactoviral Research Promo Card
Description:
Summer Season Promo 2021 of FryxGames, which you can buy on its own, or get for free if you order a certain amount at their webstore.

Bactoviral Research

It's a green card with a cost of 10 M€. It has a science- and microbe-tag.

Effect: Draw 1 card. Choose one of your played cards and add 1 microbe to it for each science tag you have, including this one.

Promo card X35

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Harbringers of Destruction
Description:
Nowhere is safe from the ravages of the bestial warriors of Gorkamorka, not even the domain of the Everchosen. The din of battle that echoes throughout the Bloodwind Spoil draws orruks, ogors, and grots like moths to a flame. Here, the strong survive, and the weak are but prey. Savage warbands fight anyone they can find to prove themselves the meanest and toughest of all – and because it fills their brutal hearts with joy.

Harbingers of Destruction is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Destruction in games of Warcry. Four large warbands are detailed in full, from the diminutive Gloomspite Gitz to the hulking Ogor Mawtribes. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Destruction in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:

     Full rules for the following warbands: Bonesplitterz, Ironjawz, Gloomspite Gitz, and Ogor Mawtribes.
     Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Destruction ranges.
     Rules for three Monsters of Destruction: The Aleguzzler Gargant, the Skitterstrand Arachnarok, and the Dankhold Troggoth.
     Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
     New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
     Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
     4 Destruction Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
     6 Destruction Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.


If you want to raise your voice in a throaty bellow and get stuck in, this 64-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carry On: Drafting Card Game
Description:
Carry On is a drafting game where players pick a card to pack and passes the rest on. The heavier items you pack the more points you accumulate, but be sure to stay within your luggage limit or pay an excess baggage fee.

A game of Carry On consists of 3 rounds and the player who collects the most points win. Players assume the roles of different characters and can accumulate bonus points by collecting specific cards. There are 4 different types of Basic Item cards that players can choose from: Clothing; Document; Gadget; and Hygiene cards. Collect one of each Basic Item cards and receive extra points. You can also collect souvenir cards along the way, upgrade your luggage limit, or simply pack some carry on.

Watch out! there’s a catch. Players do not know how much they can pack until it’s too late.

—description from the publisher

Name: Die lustige Reise um die Welt
Description:
The players roll the dice and move their game piece over a network of paths to collect six different pieces each. These are initially face down and you should remember the ones that another player was not allowed to take. The first player to return to the starting field with 6 different pieces wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Dungeon Care
Description:
In the absence of the Villains, an ancient dungeon is the place where "Dungeon Care", a mysterious organisation, provides special services. They gather the children of the Villains, little Villennials, so they can safely await their parents' return, and at the same time do not break out to the surface to wreak havoc and destruction...

You will play as a brave Adventurer who will descend deep into these dungeons with a special task - take the role of a caretaker of this place, who survives until the next dawn and won't hurt any of the monsters inside!

Occasional looting of the dungeon is accepted.

The little Villennials, however, will not make things easy for you. They will set traps and throw a variety of challenges at you. Their pets will try to tear you up, and their dark moods will threaten your mental health.

Your role is to be patient and not get stuffed. The good part is, that the energy and ideas of the little Villennials are not limitless. At some point they will simply fall asleep...

On the other hand, if your entire party will drop dead from exhaustion or lose their temper, thus falling into a berzerk - your career and adventure in Dungeon Care will be over...

Throughout the game, players will play their individual skill and equipment cards together with those found while searching the dungeons in an attempt to overcome the Challenge cards posed by the little Villennials. The key is to keep your Endurance and Patience stats up while trying to avoid stacking the Dark Mood tokens on the Villennials cards. The game ends when the deck of Challenge cards is exhausted and if any of the Adventurers are conscious - they are victorious!

Dungeon Care is a 1-4 player, fast paced, cooperative fantasy card game. It gives you a mixture of classic RPG's, semi-cooperative competition and crazy party game.

The game offers different gameplay modes such as: freelance (solo mode), one-night adventure (default game scenario) or corporate career (kind of campaign with the character development and expanding dungeon).

—description from the designer

Name: The Happy Shell Farmer
Description:
An Australian board game from the 1920's that depicts rural Australia farming life and advertises Shell oils and lubricants.

Players start at a homestead in the center of the board and follow a path that passes various farming activities such as ploughing, milking, harvesting and shearing before returning to home. Each Farming task is accompanied with advice on which Shell oil or lubricant is needed.

Players move by spin of a teetotum and if a player lands on a red square he must detour to one of the farming activities, after they reach the activity they return to the main path and continue with the spin of the teetotum. The player to reach home (square 100) by exact count is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Enigma: Crime Scene
Description:
Enigma: Crime Scene is a replayable crime investigation game that can be competitively, cooperatively or imposter mode.

Players attempt to pinpoint the criminal from 10 suspects using a variety of tools including newspapers, riddle cards, maps, fingerprint cards and more. The base games comes with 4 scenarios set in London, New York, Chicago, and Sicily. 3 cards (location, weapon, and fingerprints) are placed face down on the board.

The first person to combine the location, weapon and fingerprints clues and find the criminal, wins the game.

—description from publisher

Name: Constructo Quiz
Description:
The players have to guess a word secretly written down by the game leader based on information about individual letters. The earlier you give a correct guess, the more points you get. Mistakes are penalized with a point deduction. After an agreed number of words, the game leader is changed. Whoever has the most points at the end wins.

—user summary

Name: Krigsspelet
Description:
A conflict resolution card game with a lot of silly humour. Created by 13 and 15 year old Dan and Claes Lindman during a summer holiday and then published by Swedens national umbrella organisation for gaming clubs, SVEROK.

The game is a easy conflict resolution card game played with one six sided dice (D6). Rules are simple and swift with additional rules very specific to each card.

Name: Deckel drauf
Description:
On a 3x3 board with 9 numbered squares, the goal is to win rounds by covering the most squares with tiles. First, 9 of a player's 27 pieces are randomly placed on the squares at the same time. Then the players take turns to draw 2 pieces each from the bag and place them one after the other in the squares 1-9. Then the players take turns, there are two possibilities: Either move one of your own stones as you wish, or cover a square in which there are exactly 5 of your own stones, no matter how many opposing stones are in it. If no more fields can be covered, the game ends, whoever has covered more fields wins the round, with 3 won rounds you win the game.

—user summary

Name: Pez a la Vista
Description:
The beautiful Tiwiimi River is home to the greatest fish. On its shores, various tribes compete with their handmade boats in a fierce annual competition. The tribe that catches the most fish gains prestige and honor. This time you will lead the expedition to the river so get ready and manage your boats as best you can to get as many points as possible.

During his turn, the player must risk taking out boats to have more options to fish. After a few decks you choose a fish card, and place it in the river to gain points and resources. Then the fishing phase follows where you activate your boats and use the resources to catch fish and earn more victory points. After this, the purchase phase follows where you acquire boats to improve the deck and catch a greater number of fish.

The game ends when the four decks have the same number of players or less and the winner is the one with the highest score among their ships of the same color and tokens.

—description from publisher



El hermoso río tiwiimi alberga los más grandiosos peces y en sus orillas diversas tribus pesqueras que con sus barcos hechos artesanalmente se baten en una feroz competencia anual, por tanto, la tribu que atrapa más peces gana prestigio y honor, esta vez tú lideraras la expedición al río así que prepárate y gestiona lo mejor posible tus embarcaciones logrando  obtener la mayor cantidad de puntos posibles.

Name: Stellar Empire: Skirmish
Description:
Stellar Empire is a 15 minute 2 player strategic card game, requiring critical thinking and clever bluffing.

You take the role of a fleet admiral, and your goal is to capture as many planets along your stellar border as you can with the expedition fleet at your disposal. Some planets along the border are more ideal than others, but even a barren rock can be mined for resources. You will lead either the Royal Expedition Force of the Wami Kingdom, or the 3rd Fleet of the Neupert Prefecture.

Each turn, the opposing fleets engage over one of the contested planets, and players select a vessel to engage. As the more powerful ship prevails, the system will join the victors stellar empire. If the ships fight to a draw, as they skulk away to lick their wounds, the following battles become more important, as the victor of the next battle will be able to lay claim to each system where combat was unresolved.

Once both players have exhausted their entire fleet, cooler heads will prevail and an armistice will be signed.

While both stellar empires may have made territorial claims, only the empire with the more worthwhile conquest can justify the skirmish and be called the victor!

Name: Outlander: The Series – The Board Game
Description:
Step through the stones of Craigh na Dun and run through the Scottish Highlands with the handsome Jamie. The year is 1743, and the outlaw James Fraser is at your side as you navigate the thrills and dangers of the Highlands. Use your wit, reach the right locations, make the right friends, and gather the items you need, all while keeping Jamie out of the hands of the many who would do him wrong. The gallows await fair Jamie (or worse!) should you fail. Fulfill your destiny and win his heart, only then will victory be yours!

Players select an Event scenario to fulfill. During turns, players can bid to gain cards, move meeples, or reduce Danger. As Jamie moves about the board, he may encounter any of three enemies: The Watch, The Red Coats, and Black Jack Randall. If Jamie should encounter an enemy with no means of escape, the Event is failed and the game is lost for every player. As a co-operative game, every player aims to fulfill the Event in play to win the game. Competitively, the player who has gained the most Favour from Jamie wins his heart and is the true winner of the game. The game ends when all of the conditions in the Event are fulfilled, or if Jamie is captured. Once the event conditions are fulfilled, the player who has acquired the most Favour from Jamie wins the game.

—description from publisher

Name: 2020: The Best Year Ever
Description:
2020: The Best Year Ever (The Game) is a “2020 themed” board game. It cleverly uses the events of 2020 to draw players together based on their common experience of the year. “Play cards” encourage players to “act out”  common (and their own) 2020 experiences while “Point cards” memorialize well known AND little known events of 2020 while helping OR hurting a player’s “score.” Using unconventional (and fluid) game rules, players are kept involved and “off balance” (much like we all were during 2020) as each game unfolds differently depending on the cards drawn.

2020: The Best Year Ever (The Game) uses dice, a spinner, and unique cards hat guide players through 2020 related challenges, activities and conversations while players collect (plus and minus) points until the games ends - at any moment - in one of several possible ways. The player with the highest points at the end wins.

Name: Motif
Description:
Two players, three sides. Six pawns, no dice. Are you ready to turn fate into your favor?

Motif is a game with one objective: occupy more squares than your opponent. It is a head-to-head board game comprised of simple rules and brilliant tactics.

Players attempt to control the largest area on a 5 x 5 grid board using zone of control tactics. Each piece added to the board affects all the other pieces of the same color so careful placement is the key to winning the most squares and the game.

Motif always begins with an empty board — no pawns, all white squares.

On each turn:


    Add a new pawn to any square that is reachable by your existing pawns if any.
     Move your other pawns on the board. Relocate all of them if possible. Pawns can freely maneuver around other pawns in complicated trails. Diagonals and jumps are prohibited.
    Turn squares into the same color as the pawn that lands on it. Pawns always leave a mark.
     Play until all the squares are occupied.


The player with the most squares in their color wins.

—description from publisher

Name: Quadzzles
Description:
The six 1.5-inch cubes are lasercut from white wooden hardboard. They are sent unassembled in 36 pieces. Simply friction-fit the sides together into six cubes and you are ready to play.
 Roll or shuffle the cubes and place randomly in the tray. Use one letter from adjacent (top) “quads” to make words of at least three letters, in either direction. Words can start anywhere. Write down all your words.

After three minutes, compare all words to opponents’ words. Remove duplicates and illegal words. Score only the unique words, one point per letter. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from publisher

Name: Relics of Rajavihara: Montalo's Revenge
Description:
Returning to Cambodia after receiving a mysterious letter detailing Professor Montalo’s previous theft of the powerful Seer Stone, you find yourself in a trap set by his vengeful son, Arioch.

He has created an even more dangerous set of traps than you faced previously. So, this is Montalo’s revenge…

30 new levels. 3 additional new elements.

Are you up for the challenge?

Name: Epic Zoo
Description:
EPIC ZOO is a new project which focuses on creating a zoo with fantastic animals, with a quick dynamic to learn that does not include violence in its mechanics, which makes EPIC ZOO the ideal game for all audiences.

EPIC ZOO is a game in which you must plan your expansion strategy and overcome obstacles.

Name: Eurasia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
The map is (geographically) large but there are actually less tracks overall than the US map. There are slightly more single routes but many less double routes (and less than I intended when I started this). After playing a few more 4 and 5 player games, some players in our group have expressed the wish that we use stations with this map as well, because some of the destinations may become hard to reach even with 4 players.

—description from publisher

Name: Guessed List
Description:
A fun fast party game for all where you choose a List Title and then shout as many answers as you can in 30 seconds to try to guess a specific name on the Guessed List and win the card.

Each list contains 6 names. Roll a die to determine which of the 6 names, you will have to guess. You have 30 seconds to make a correct guess and win the card. The player who has won the most cards after 5 rounds is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Champ'd Up: Slam Down
Description:
Champ’d Up: Slam Down is a collectable card game with custom decks of cards generated by playing Champ’d Up from The Jackbox Party Pack 7. The games live in the same universe, but they’re totally different. For starters, one is a video game and one is a card game. Also, one is an 8-player party game about making funny characters and the other is a 2-player combat strategy card game.

Champ’d Up: Slam Down is a unique two-player card game where each player takes the role of a trainer battling champs against their opponent until only one player is left standing/sitting! Each turn you will recruit champs from your hand into the ring to fight your opponent’s champs. Deplete your opponent’s reserves and call them out to declare victory and win the game!

To get a pack (you only need one), play an online game of Champ’d Up in The Jackbox Party Pack 7. Create ridiculous champs and battle them for supremacy. But draw with care because these champs are going to make their way into the physical world! After your game, you can purchase a pack of Champ’d Up: Slam Down cards with the characters you created in Champ’d Up. It will be custom printed and delivered right to your door. When you receive your cards, grab a friend and play this simple but exciting take on a 1-on-1 collectable card game. Combine decks and trade cards with others for even more ridiculous mayhem.

Players will take turns until a player wins the game. The player who is taking a turn is referred to as the “active player.” At the very start of their turn, the active player gets 3 energy. On the active player's turn, they can use energy to execute a variety of actions: Recruit, Hype, Fight, use Special abilities, and Call out their Opponent. Slam Down's custom cards means a diverse variety of cards can be printed from playing Champ'd Up (in the Jackbox Party Pack 7) repeat times. Fighting is how players remove opposing champs from the ring. If the active player has a champ in the ready position and their opponent has no players in the ring, the active player can call them out. If the active player calls out an opponent with no champs in their reserve, the game ends and they win the game!

—description from publisher

Name: Desolation Dungeon
Description:
In Desolation Dungeon you can play as either The Dungeon master or one of the heroes.

The Dungeon Master begins the game by laying out room cards with hidden traps and monsters and rooms in a way that will hinder the Hero’s on their journey to steal your loot!!! During the hero's turn, the players can choose up to 3 separate actions to search the dungeon, fight the monsters and escape with the loot.

Play continues until the Dungeon Masters has collected 10 hero souls or there is one hero left with 12 treasure points.

The game is for 2-5 players with multiple game scenarios and a solo variant for playing by yourself as the hero. Currently the stand alone version of the game is 165 cards with one expansion of 20 cards (10 for the hero, and 10 for the Dungeon master).

—description from publisher

Name: Штука (The Thingy)
Description:
The Thingy is a party game based on charades and searching details on paintings, each depicting a scene packed with various objects.

In Each round,  one player describes the hidden item with charades, words, drawings, or yes/no questions. Other players try to find the item on the picture among hundreds of other objects and snatch the thingy first as soon as finding the answer!

The player who was the first to find the right item moves their token on the scoring board ahead. The player who reaches the end of the scoring path first, wins.

Various paintings and numerous task cards to play over and over again.

—description from publisher

Name: The Glorious First of June: a scenario for Far Distant Ships
Description:
The Glorious First of June - Le Bataille du 13 Prairial An 2 is a scenario pack covering the battle known to the British as the Glorious First of June, and to the French as La Bataille du 13 prairial an 2, 1st June 1794.

In which Admiral Lord Howe attempts to defeat a French fleet under Rear Admiral Villaret-Joyeuse seeking to protect a vital grain convoy heading to France from North America.

—description from the publisher

Name: Selva: La fuerza de la Naturaleza
Description: Selva is a Chilean Trading Card Game in which players pitch the forces of nature against each other. Turns are split into two phases, a day phase and a night phase, in which different kinds of animals can attack, depending on their natural habits. You can try to block attacks against you, and you will try to increase the number of resource cards on the table to be able to add more cards to your layout. The goal is to reduce your opponent(s) Alpha animal to 0 life points.

Name: Hegemon: A Wargaming Campaign in Ancient Greece
Description:
Hegemon: A Wargaming Campaign in Ancient Greece is set circa 340BCE and pits Macedon against Persia with Greece as the battlefield. 
It is specifically designed for DBA 3.0 but is likely to be easily adapted to other sets of rules which cater for battles of around ten to 20 units.

The campaign features a point to point map of Greece. Each turn represents a year and consists of a winter administration phase and two campaign seasons. 
Campaigns are likely to last three to five years (although a spectacular failure could see a campaign concluded in a single year) and likely to feature an average of three battles per year.

During winter players spend their budget to bribe/persuade Greek city states in a variety of ways to make them amenable to a player's plans and to buy new elements to reinforce armies in the following year. 
During each of the two campaign seasons players move their army or armies on the map and invade hostile Greek states, the armies of which are played by the opposing player.

The winner of the campaign will be the player who allies the greatest number of Greek states, or at least renders them neutral, by the time either Macedon or Persia cannot field an army sufficiently strong to continue.

Although written with this specific hypothetical campaign as its basis, the campaign mechanisms are portable to other eras and armies, with the requirement only that the player create an appropriate point to point map of the area of operations. The article includes half a dozen ways in which to vary the original campaign and brief notes suggesting other historical conflicts of the classical period which might be simulated.

The article is fourteen pages long and incorporates a campaign map and a budget tracking graphic.

Finally it also presents a very simple methodology for resolving battles in a DBA style using any flat surface and 30 or so dice of different colours. This will allow the player to experiment with the campaign framework without committing himself to six to twelve DBA battles.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC

Name: Skojarzenia
Description:
Each player or team starts at a corner of the board and movies along a track to the center. Players, in turns, draw cards containing phrases belonging to various categories and then they either pantomime or make drawings to indicate the phrase that matches the color of the spot they are on. A timer keeps every turn short.

Each player or team mark their score on the board. The first team to get to the centre spot on the board win the game.

The game contains 2100 phrases on 300 cards.

—user summary

Name: Butter
Description:
Butter is a quick and engaging card game with simple rules but wide-ranging strategy. Once you have a few singles games under your belt, try team play! The rules change slightly, but the strategy explodes with so many more possibilities.

The game centers around adding number cards to your stack so they sum to 18, which is called buttering your stack. You earn one point for every card you butter. Use Slice, Churn, Spoil, and Butter cards to steal, swap, and bust your and other player's stacks.

To win, score the most points in three rounds!

—description from publisher

Name: L'histoire en boîte le jeu
Description:
Each player chooses an epoch to build his/her empire in, antiquity, the middle ages, the modern, or the contemporary one. Each epoch consist of 50 cards (40 questions, 5 bonus and 5 penalty cards).

At the beginning of the game each epoch deck is shuffled and placed in front of the player to the right, that player will be asking the questions.

The youngest player starts the game. On his turn he must answer questions related to his epoch. The question cards contains two questions, from which only one will be asked. Each time you get an answer right you gain the card and your turn continues. When an incorrect answer is given, the turn is ended and play moves on to the next player on the left.

On the back of each question card is a drawing that is part of the epoch fresco that the player is trying to complete. With each right answer, the question card is placed in front of the player with the drawing side up, helping to complete the fresco.

Penalty and Bonus cards contains only one question. A wrong answer for a penalty card makes you lose an already won card. A  right answer for a bonus card lets you keep the bonus card to protect you against a penalty card.

The first payer to correctly answers 40 questions and complete his/her fresco wins.

—user summary
